meanings.definition: The measurement of the field of vision.
meanings.sent1: During the perimetry, the doctor checked how wide my vision was.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist used perimetry to assess the extent of my visual field.
meanings.sent3: The perimetry test felt like a game of mapping out my sight.
meanings.sent4: Her perimetry results painted a clear picture of her field of vision.
meanings.sent5: The perimetry revealed the boundaries of my eyesight like a detailed map.

meanings.definition: The technique used to measure the visual field.
meanings.sent1: Using perimetry, the ophthalmologist determined the extent of my visual field.
meanings.sent2: Perimetry is a valuable tool in assessing the range of one's vision.
meanings.sent3: The perimetry process seemed like a fun way to explore my field of vision.
meanings.sent4: Her skillful perimetry technique uncovered hidden aspects of her visual field.
meanings.sent5: The precision of perimetry made the measurement of my visual field crystal clear.
